Develop and implement ITSM configuration management processes, policies, and procedures.          Lead the identification, classification, and recording of all hardware and software assets.          Establish and maintain a comprehensive Configuration Management Database (CMDB).          Coordinate with various IT teams to capture and update configuration information for all assets. column2: Reports To: [Company Owner/President/CEO or appropriate executive] Summary: The IT Manager will play a pivotal role in securing, managing, and optimizing our company's IT infrastructure to enable seamless operations and achieve business objectives. This position requires a strategic thinker with expertise in network security, cybersecurity, automation, and IT project management. The ideal candidate is a proactive leader who can anticipate challenges, troubleshoot issues effectively, and align IT initiatives with overall company goals. Role & responsibilities    Network and Cybersecurity Management: Oversee the design, implementation, and maintenance of secure network infrastructure, including firewalls and CCTV systems. Implement robust cybersecurity measures to protect company data and assets.  IT Infrastructure and Systems: Ensure reliable operation of all IT systems, including servers, software, and hardware. Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues promptly.  Strategic Planning and Innovation: Develop and implement IT strategies that support the company's growth and efficiency goals. Research and implement innovative technological solutions.  Vendor Management: Establish and maintain strong relationships with IT vendors and service providers, ensuring optimal service delivery and cost-effectiveness.  Technical Support and Training: Provide IT support to staff, resolve issues, and conduct training to enhance technology adoption within the company.  Project Management: Lead IT projects from initiation to completion, overseeing timelines, budgets, and resource allocation.  System Analysis and Optimization: Evaluate existing IT systems and processes, identifying areas for improvement and implementing necessary optimizations.  Disaster Recovery: Develop and maintain disaster recovery plans to ensure business continuity in case of system failures or security breaches.  Data Protection and Compliance: Ensure adherence to data privacy regulations and industry-specific compliance standards.  Team Leadership: Manage, mentor, and develop the IT team, fostering a culture of collaboration and continuous improvement.  Automation Expertise: Drive efficiency gains by identifying and implementing automation opportunities, particularly within financial and accounting processes. Preferred candidate profile   Education: Bachelor's degree in IT, Computer Science, or a related field.  Experience: Minimum of 5+ years of experience in IT management. Experience in finance or accounting sectors is highly advantageous.  Skills: Strong technical proficiency in network security, firewalls, CCTV, cybersecurity protocols, and data protectio Expertise in IT infrastructure management, hardware, software, and cloud technologies. Proven project management skills and a track record of delivering IT projects on time and within budget. Excellent problem-solving, analytical, and critical thinking abilities. Strong leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills. Adaptability and a willingness to embrace new technologies and innovative solutions. Fluency in English, Hindi, and Gujarati Preferred Candidate Profile  Age: 30+  Gender: Male  Marital Status: Married  Location: Within 10-15 km radius for convenient commuting.  Work Hours: 11 am to 9 pm or 1:00 PM  11:00 PM  Work Days: 5.5 days per week  Security Deposit: Two months' salary, to be collected within 6 months of employment (negotiable)

column2: Unity is seeking a dedicated and detail-oriented IT Asset & Procurement Management Specialist to join our Enterprise Technology team. This role plays a crucial part in hands-on assistance with maintaining optimal inventory levels, assisting with IT procurement activities, and ensuring compliance with asset management policies. Additionally, the ideal candidate will contribute to the smooth onboarding and off boarding of IT vendors, contractors, software/services. This role requires strong organizational skills, a keen eye for detail, and a proactive approach to asset, vendor, contract lifecycle management and procurement.             What youll be doing         Collaborate with IT teams to oversee software asset, vendor, contract and service lifecycle stages, including procurement, deployment, maintenance, and decommissioning     Develop strategies for maintaining minimum inventory levels, planning timely renewals/ upgrades/terminations and cultivate/maintain relationships with vendors for IT procurement, warranties, and service agreements     Assist in negotiating favorable terms for services and software purchases /renewals.     Collaborate with HR and IT teams to ensure seamless vendor/contract onboarding for new hires and site personnel, additionally, collaboration is required with IT and procurement teams to identify requirements and initiate procurement processes     Manage procurement processes, including obtaining quotes, reviewing proposals, negotiating terms with vendors for cost-effectiveness, ensuring compliance with software licensing agreements and regulatory requirements, and generating regular reports on contracts, vendors, utilization, and compliance for management review         What were looking for         Experience in vendor management, procurement, inventory control, or related roles.     Experience in using asset management software, inventory tracking tools, and spreadsheets.     Strong understanding of software and services contracts (Renewals, SoW, etc.), Vendor onboarding, off boarding and their lifecycle stages.     Excellent analytical skills to identify discrepancies, optimize inventory, and prevent shortages.     Assist in the onboarding and off boarding vendors, contractors         You might also have         Utilize automation tools and technologies to streamline software asset management, Cost Center spends, procurement, and reporting     Continuously assess and enhance procurement processes to improve accuracy, efficiency, and effectiveness.         Additional information         Relocation support is not available for this position.     International relocation support is not available for this position.     Work visa/immigration sponsorship is not available for this position.

column1: IT Senior Systems Administrator - End User Compute
column2: Headquartered in Denver, United States. Sundyne is a leading manufacturer of highly reliable and efficient centrifugal pumps and compressors for use in the oil and gas, petrochemical, chemical, power generation and water processing industries. The Sundyne product portfolio features innovative high-speed integrally geared, multistage and sealless technologies that meet API and ISO standards. With a global channel consisting of more than 300 sales and service locations, and a manufacturing network that employs over 1,000 people across 5 facilities, Sundyne provides high quality engineered fluid handling solutions to customers around the world. For additional information, visit www.sundyne.com. Position Description  : The Senior Systems Administrator will primarily be a hands-on member of the Infrastructure team and will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of the End User Compute tower. This includes anything from planning, documenting, communicating, researching, scripting, installing, configuring, troubleshooting, architecting, and engineering solutions for all End User Computing needs. Secondly, in this position the administrator will be expected to regularly interface, oversee and manage the outsourced service provider resources to ensure productivity, quality and stability of the assigned technologies/solutions. Finally, the administrator will also regularly interface with business users in Arvada, CO as the designated Site Lead to understand the sites needs, understand issues and then translate these needs or issues into IT solutions.  For a detailed list of responsibilities and in-scope technologies please refer to the responsibilities & requirements section.  Job Duties & Responsibilities  : Responsible for the Global End User Compute environment covering asset management, license management, Windows 7/10 golden image maintenance, architecture, engineering, and solution deployment.  This role will be the technical lead on the design, installation, maintenance, configuration, and integrity of all desktops, laptops, thin clients, and mobile devices.  Responsible for architecting Windows 10 and Office 365 Pro Plus deployment technologies and update channels using SCCM/Intune/Zero Touch.  Responsibilities include design of all desktop encryption, anti-virus, anti-malware, data backup/recovery and Group Policy solutions.  This role will manage the outsourced service providers EUC tower resources and will also take level 3 escalations from the desktop support team / managed services vendors.  Azure AD/Intune/Zero Touch/Co-management, especially regarding MDM and other device management strategies  Software metering and overall licensing management  Asset and asset lifecycle management  Perform as a subject matter expert on solutions implemented and provide tactical roadmaps for EUC space  Research and integration of new desktop technologies  Participate in design, implementation, testing and launching of end user technologies  Presentations to Senior IT and business leadership regarding tactical decisions to defend recommendations and collect feedback to ensure IT alignment  Collaborate with cross-functional partners (IT personnel, support outsourced providers, consultants, technology suppliers and company business users) relative to the implementation of new or revised technologies, capabilities and future Company End User Tech standards and current environment  As a member of the infrastructure team this role will be responsible for change management, problem management, incident management and IT security as it relates to the End User Compute Environment.  Required Skills/Abilities: Must have experience in JDE  Excellent interpersonal skills with a proven ability to collaborate with a team. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. Extensive knowledge of computer systems and programming. Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail. Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or related software. Proficient with or able to quickly learn systems and software used by the organization. Expert in Operating Systems, particularly Windows 10 and all update channel considerations, having designed and supported desktop environments of 2000+ endpoints  Expert in Office 365 Pro Plus, OneDrive, Teams and SharePoint, having Implemented Office and Microsoft 365 solutions in a medium scale environment, to include best practices around O365 license management  Expert in Microsoft on-premise AD and Azure AD, including Federation services. Including Active Directory Domain Management/Administration, with emphasis on optimizing EUC-facing GPO's.  Strong knowledge of desktop encryption technologies, with emphasis on BitLocker  Strong knowledge of Microsoft Intune, Zero Touch and SCCM, with practical knowledge of Windows 10 Task Sequencing, driver and BIOS management, patching and application updates  Strong familiarity with Dell PC's and Laptops, and best practices around driver management, BIOS updates, settings, etc.  Solid understanding of cloud computing concepts, advantages and practices (e.g. IaaS -, Azure, etc.)  Solid understanding of Server, Network and Storage technologies  Local Admin rights management (LAPS)  Virtualization Technologies (Citrix, VMware)  Knowledge of GDPR, ITAR, Data Protection implications  Knowledge of ITSM and tools (e.g. ServiceNow) is a plus  Knowledge of SharePoint, Sharegate, Nintex Workflows and MS Flow  Knowledge of Databases (SQL, MySQL, Oracle)  High degree of professional poise, presence, and personal integrity  Ability to work with all levels of personnel Education and Experience: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, MIS or related subjects preferred.  10+ years of related experience required with medium scale IT enterprise around Windows workstation OS environment.  A+, MCSE/MCSA, and VMware certifications preferred.
column11: AZURE, Intune, SCCM, windows 10, microsoft office suite, office 365

column2: Education Qualification: Graduation (Science background) /    Diploma in Electronics & Telecommunications      CCNA Certified / MCSA Certified / ITIL certified      Job Type: Permanent      Job Overview:      The IT Asset Administrator is responsible for the effective management of the    IT asset lifecycle within the organization. This includes planning, monitoring,    and recording software licenses and/or hardware assets to ensure compliance    with vendor contracts. The administrator will also assist in forming    procurement strategies to optimize technology spend across the organization.      Responsibilities and Duties:      * Asset allocation and release as per defined checklist.    * Develop and implement procedures for tracking company assets to oversee    quality control throughout their lifecycles.    * Manage IT hardware asset inventory with respect to risk, cost control,    governance, compliance, and performance objectives.    * Plan and implement IT asset life cycle strategy; advise on and participate    in the procurement process; manage software licenses.    * Ensure compliance with vendor license agreements by auditing and monitoring    usage; recommend changes to optimize spending and software deployment.    * Conduct analyses and prepare reports on asset life cycle and performance    for management.    * Serve as a point of contact between external vendors and internal    stakeholders for all asset-related issues.    * Coordinate with IT staff to ensure assets are properly deployed and    utilized.    * Train staff on IT asset management policies and procedures.    * Perform regular audits to ensure the IT asset database is accurate and up    to date.    * Manage the disposal of obsolete or replaced assets in an environmentally    responsible and data-secure manner.Qualifications:      * Bachelor s degree in Information Technology, Business Administration, or    related field.    * Proven experience in IT asset management or related field.    * Strong understanding of IT asset life cycles, software licensing, and IT    procurement.    * Excellent organizational, analytical, and problem-solving skills.    * Proficient in ITAM software and databases.    * Strong communication and interpersonal skills.    * Ability to work independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative    environment.Skills:      * Detail-oriented with the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.    * Strong analytical skills and the ability to develop and implement    operational processes.    * Excellent communication and negotiation skills.    * Knowledge of IT industry trends, solutions, and products.    * Ability to maintain confidential and sensitive information.    * Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and IT Asset Management software.

column2: SAP SuccessFactors Techno-Functional Consultant will play a crucial role in implementing and optimizing the SAP SuccessFactors Human Capital Management (HCM) suite. This role combines technical expertise with a deep understanding of business processes. Responsible for taking ownership and driving functional and technical changes and maintaining the system. Collaborating closely with business stakeholders to understand and document business requirements, design, and configure the system ensuring alignment with business needs and scalability. Work closely with the vendor, drive functional and technical discussion, validate solutions proposed by vendor and the estimate for same, and ensure timely delivery. Responsibilities: Requirements Analysis & Gathering: Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand  Gather HR and business requirements. Analyze existing processes and system configuration, identify opportunities for improvement. Solution Design: Design and architect SAP SuccessFactors solutions based on identified. requirements. Develop and present functional and technical design documents. Configuration and Customization: Configure SAP SuccessFactors modules according to business.  requirements. Develop and implement custom solutions when needed. Integration Management: Develop and manage integrations between SuccessFactors and other.  enterprise systems. Data Management: Understand data flow, structure, and mapping. Ensuring data integrity and  completeness. Testing and Quality Assurance:    Develop and execute test plans to ensure the quality of  SuccessFactors solutions.      Troubleshoot issues, and coordinate user acceptance testing. User Training and Support: Conduct      user training sessions and provide ongoing support to ensure  successful adoption of SuccessFactors within the organisation. Documentation: Create and maintain      comprehensive documentation of SuccessFactors  configurations, customisations, integrations, and processes. Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to optimise the use of SuccessFactors in  various business processes. Vendor Management: Work closely with the vendor, drive functional and technical discussion,  validate solutions proposed by vendor and the estimate for same and ensure timely delivery. Upgrades and Enhancements: Stay informed about new releases and updates to SuccessFactors.  Plan and execute system upgrades, apply patches, and implement new features. Qualifications: Bachelors degree in computer science, Information Systems, or a related field. Consultants having  SAP SuccessFactors Associate/Professional Certification will be preferred. Proven experience as a SuccessFactors Techno-Functional Consultant  in a similar role. Good  understanding of Onboarding/Offboarding, EC, Performance, and Compensation modules. Strong understanding of  SuccessFactors configurations, customisations, and integration concepts. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions.

column2: Job Description:  We are seeking a skilled and dedicated IT Support professional to join our team in Coimbatore. The successful candidate will be responsible for managing and maintaining our IT assets, providing technical support across various levels, and ensuring the smooth operation of our websites and systems. This is a global role supporting staff across five continents: the UK, South Africa and India. Effective communication is crucial as the role involves interacting with a diverse, international team. Key Responsibilities: Asset Management: Utilize Qandle(Tool) for asset management, ensuring all IT assets are properly tracked and maintained. Website Hosting & Domain Management: Basic website administration and act as the single point of contact for the vendor handling regular updates and other configurations for our group and partner companies. Technical Support: Provide Tier 1 and Tier 2 support internally using Qandle's ticketing system. For other queries, raise issues with the respective service providers and follow up to ensure resolution. Office 365 Administration: Full administration and user management of Office 365, including: Mailbox administration Shared mailboxes Public folders Security and compliance Azure Active Directory Teams Administration and etc Recruitly - CRM: Full administration, user management, and training for the Recruitly CRM system. Qandle/ActivTrack  Remote Monitoring Solutions: Full administration, ensuring general system availability, user management, and remote toolkit administration. Dialpad (VOIP Phone System): Full administration and user management of Dialpad. Additional Tools: Management and support of LinkedIn Recruiter, HelloSign, Talent-LMS and other business tools and technologies. System Support: Manage and resolve issues with user devices remotely, ensuring minimal disruption to operations. Advanced Support: For Tier 3 and other critical or unknown support issues, coordinate with the respective service providers. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field. Proven experience in IT support roles. Strong knowledge of asset management systems Proficiency in Office 365 administration, including mailbox and user management, security, and Azure Active Directory. Experience with website hosting, domain management, and general system administration. Familiarity with CRM systems. Knowledge of remote monitoring solutions like Qandle/ActivTrack. Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work under pressure. Strong communication skills and the ability to provide training and support to end-users across different time zones. Certification in relevant IT support or administration fields is a plus. We are ready to sponsor a Microsoft 365 admin certification for the right candidate. Experience in supporting a global workforce across multiple time zones.

column2: Job Summary: We are seeking a highly skilled IT Support Specialist with expertise in Microsoft 365 to join our support team. The ideal candidate will provide comprehensive technical support for software, network, email, and backup issues within a Microsoft 365 environment. This role requires excellent problem-solving skills, a strong technical background, and a customer-focused mindset to ensure effective and efficient resolution of IT-related issues. Key Responsibilities: - Microsoft 365 Support: - Provide timely and effective technical support for Microsoft 365 applications, including Outlook, Teams, SharePoint, OneDrive, and other related services. - Manage and troubleshoot issues related to Microsoft 365 email accounts, including account setup, configuration, and email delivery problems. - Assist users with the migration and synchronization of data within Microsoft 365 applications. - Technical Support: - Provide comprehensive technical support to end-users for software, network, and backup issues. - Troubleshoot and resolve hardware and software problems, including operating systems and applications. - Assist with the setup, configuration, and maintenance of IT equipment and software. - Network Support: - Monitor and maintain network infrastructure, including routers, switches, firewalls, and wireless access points. - Perform regular network maintenance and upgrades to ensure optimal performance and security. - Diagnose and resolve network-related issues, including connectivity problems and performance bottlenecks. - Backup Support: - Implement and manage backup solutions to ensure data integrity and availability. - Monitor backup processes and perform regular testing to verify data recovery capabilities. - Troubleshoot and resolve backup-related issues and failures. - Customer Service: - Provide excellent customer service by effectively communicating with users and addressing their concerns promptly. - Document and track support requests using a ticketing system, ensuring timely resolution and follow-up. - Conduct user training sessions to improve technical knowledge and reduce support requests. - Documentation and Reporting: - Create and maintain detailed documentation for IT processes, procedures, and troubleshooting guides. - Generate regular reports on support activities, issue resolution times, and system performance. Qualifications: - Education and Experience: - Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field, or equivalent work experience. - Minimum of 2-3 years of experience in IT support, with a focus on Microsoft 365, network, email, and backup support. - Technical Skills: - Proficiency in Microsoft 365 administration and support, including Outlook, Teams, SharePoint, OneDrive, and other related services. - Strong understanding of network concepts, including TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, and VPN. - Experience with email systems and email client configuration. - Knowledge of backup solutions and best practices for data protection and recovery. - Familiarity with IT security principles and practices. - Soft Skills: - Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills. - Strong communication and interpersonal skills. - Ability to work independently and as part of a team. - Customer-focused attitude with a commitment to providing high-quality support. - Certifications (Preferred): - Microsoft Certified: Fundamentals or Associate certifications (e.g., Microsoft 365 Fundamentals, Microsoft 365 Certified: Modern Desktop Administrator Associate) - CompTIA A+, Network+, or Security+ - Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA) - ITIL Foundation
column11: G Suite, IT Support, Office, MS Office
